2.text: Combine flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.

3.text: Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl, then beat in eggs and vanilla extract.

4.text: Gradually a cup at a time add the dry ingredients from the medium bowl to the wet ingredients in the large bowl, then add chocolate chips.

5.text: Drop spoonfuls of cookie dough onto a pre-greased or a lined baking sheet.

6.text: Bake for about 10 minutes or until barley golden brown around the edges.

10.text: Add the vanilla, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and butter.

11.text: Add the flour, salt, and baking soda/powder.

12.text: Mix until fully blended; add the milk to achieve a smoothly blended dough.

13.text: Apply cooking spray to the pan so that the cookies won't stick to the baking pan.

14.text: Roll a small ball for each cookie.

15.text: Place the cookie balls on the baking pan.

16.text: Flatten each cookie with a fork.

17.text: Put cookies in the oven for about 8-10 minutes or until light golden brown.

18.text: Take the cookies out of the oven and let them sit on a wire cooling rack for about 15 minutes to cool.

19.text: Store in an airtight container, or eat the cookies once they've cooled.

20.text: Oil your cookie sheet lightly as you preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C.

21.text: Mix together the flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.

22.text: Cream together the margarine, brown sugar, sugar, vanilla and egg replacer mixture in a large bowl.

23.text: Stir the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until the ingredients are well combined.

24.text: Add the chocolate chips and mix them into the batter.

25.text: Drop the dough by spoonfuls onto the cookie sheet and bake them for 8 to 10 minutes.

26.text: Cool the vegan chocolate chip cookies on a wire rack once you take them out the oven.

27.text: Serve warm or put them in your cookie jar once they've cooled for later.

30.text: Use a mixer to cream the sugars and butter together in a large bowl.

31.text: Combine the eggs, vanilla, and mashed bananas thoroughly in the butter mixture.

32.text: Add the flour mixture slowly to the butter mixture.

33.text: Place spoonfuls of the dough on a pre-greased or parchment paper layered cookie sheet.

34.text: Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 minutes.

35.text: Cool completely on a cooling rack.
